unnormalised: **Automotive News: A Deep Dive into Recent Vehicle Launches**
normalised: **Automotive News: A Deep Dive into Recent Vehicle Launches**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive sector has seen a flurry of exciting new vehicle launches recently. Dr. Arun Sharma, a leading automotive analyst from IIT Madras, sheds light on the key trends.
normalised: The Indian automotive sector has seen a flurry of exciting new vehicle launches recently. Doctor Arun Sharma, a leading automotive analyst from I I T Madras, sheds light on the key trends.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki launched its highly anticipated compact SUV, the "Brezza X," boasting enhanced fuel efficiency (28 kmpl) and advanced safety features. Initial pricing starts at Rs. 7.99 Lakh.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki launched its highly anticipated compact S U V, the "Brezza X," boasting enhanced fuel efficiency (twenty eight kilometer per liter) and advanced safety features. Initial pricing starts at rupee seven point ninety nine lakh.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled the "Nexon EV Max," an extended-range electric SUV, promising a range of 450 km on a single charge. This launch reinforces Tata's commitment to sustainable mobility.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled the "Nexon E V Max," an extended-range electric S U V, promising a range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge. This launch reinforces Tata's commitment to sustainable mobility.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra & Mahindra introduced a refreshed version of its popular Scorpio, featuring a more powerful engine and a modern infotainment system. The company is also investing heavily in its electric vehicle plant in Chakan, expanding its production capacity by 20,000 sq ft.
normalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra and Mahindra introduced a refreshed version of its popular Scorpio, featuring a more powerful engine and a modern infotainment system. The company is also investing heavily in its electric vehicle plant in Chakan, expanding its production capacity by twenty thousand square feet.

unnormalised: These launches signal a vibrant and competitive automotive market in India, offering consumers a wide range of options across price points and fuel types, catering to diverse needs from city commutes to long highway drives to places like Kanyakumari. Experts believe these developments will further boost the 'Make in India' initiative.
normalised: These launches signal a vibrant and competitive automotive market in India, offering consumers a wide range of options across price points and fuel types, catering to diverse needs from city commutes to long highway drives to places like Kanyakumari. Experts believe these developments will further boost the 'Make in India' initiative.
